snippet: In the sluggish recovery from the Great Recession, independent contractors and freelancers hope to transform hardship into opportunity.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column holds that in sluggish recovery from Great Recession, independent contractors and freelancers hope to transform hardship into opportunity; Brooklyn-based Freelancers Union, one of nation’s fastest-growing labor organizations, has had surge in membership in New York City, joined by all types of professions working in what union's founder call 'gig economy.'
lead_paragraph: In the sluggish recovery from the Great Recession, independent contractors and freelancers hope to transform hardship into opportunity.

headline.main: Freelancers in the ‘Gig Economy’ Find a Mix of Freedom and Uncertainty
headline.print_headline: Freelancers in the ‘Gig Economy’ Find a Mix of Freedom and Uncertainty
